lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qO smuMd ibKY bohQY bhwie dIjY kIjY n Broso jO lO phucY n pwr kO
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Samound Bikhai Bohadai Bahaai Deejai , Keejai N Bharoso Jau Lau Pahouchai N Paar Kau ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a ship is set to sail in the sea, but no one can know its fate till the time it reaches the shore beyond.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qO kiRswn Kyq hyqu kir joqY bovY mwnq kusl Awn pYTy giH d√çwr kO
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Krisaan Khayt Haytu Kari Jotai Bovai , Maanat Kousal Aan Paitthay Grih Dvaar Kau ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a farmer happily and delightfully ploughs the field, sows the seed, but he celebrates his happiness only when the harvested grain is brought home.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy ipr sMgm kY hoq gr hwr nwir krq hY pRIq pyiK suq ky illwr kO
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Pir Sangam Kai Hot Gar Haar Naari , Karat Hai Preet Paykhi Sout Kay Lilaar Kau ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a wife comes close to her husband to please him, but she considers her love a success only when she bears a son and he loves her.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy ausqiq inMdw krIAY n kwhU kyrI jwnIAY DO kYso idn AwvY AMq kwr kO ]595]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Ousatati Nindaa Kareeai N Kaahoo Kayree , Jaaneeai Dhau Kaiso Din Aavai Ant Kaar Kau ?595?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, no one should be praised or slandered before time. Who knows what sort of a day may dawn in the end that all his labour may bear fruit or not. (One may tread a wrong path and wander or will be accepted by the Guru ultimately).  (595)
